Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110219 Firefox/4.0b12pre

Hi,

if you have enough tabs to activate the tabs navigation arrows, and you activate the last tab in the right side, then you enter tab-candy and existing it with out do anything then the active page tab will not be visible until you scroll to it.
and this is very annoying.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create enough tabs to activate the tabs navigation arrows 
2. After the tabs navigation arrows is activated create 5 more tabs 
3. Go to the last tab in the right side and click it to made it the active tab
4. enter tab-candy either by "ctrl-shift+E" or tab-candy icon 
5. exit tab-candy either by "ctrl-shift+E" or tab-candy icon 
Actual Results:  
the latest active page is loaded but the tab related to the page is not visible, i.e you need to scroll through tabs-navigator to see the tab

Expected Results:  
the active page tab is visible
